    Irish Weather Buoy Network Data Dictionary

    get_data_dictionary.Rd

    This function returns a comprehensive data dictionary for all variables available in the Irish Weather Buoy Network dataset. Each entry includes the variable name, units, data type, description, and typical range.

    Usage

    get_data_dictionary()

    Value

    A data frame containing the complete data dictionary with columns:

    • variable: Variable name as used in the dataset

    • category: Category (dimension, meteorological, oceanographic, quality)

    • units: Measurement units

    • data_type: R data type

    • description: Detailed description of the variable

    • typical_range: Typical or valid range of values

    Examples

    dict <- get_data_dictionary()
print(dict)
#>               variable       category                    units data_type
#> 1           station_id      dimension                     <NA> character
#> 2             CallSign      dimension                     <NA> character
#> 3            longitude      dimension             degrees_east   numeric
#> 4             latitude      dimension            degrees_north   numeric
#> 5                 time      dimension seconds since 1970-01-01   POSIXct
#> 6  AtmosphericPressure meteorological                millibars   numeric
#> 7       AirTemperature meteorological                degrees_C   numeric
#> 8             DewPoint meteorological                degrees_C   numeric
#> 9        WindDirection meteorological             degrees_true   numeric
#> 10           WindSpeed meteorological                    knots   numeric
#> 11                Gust meteorological                    knots   numeric
#> 12    RelativeHumidity meteorological                  percent   numeric
#> 13      SeaTemperature  oceanographic                degrees_C   numeric
#> 14            salinity  oceanographic                      PSU   numeric
#> 15          WaveHeight  oceanographic                   meters   numeric
#> 16          WavePeriod  oceanographic                  seconds   numeric
#> 17   MeanWaveDirection  oceanographic             degrees_true   numeric
#> 18                Hmax  oceanographic                   meters   numeric
#> 19                  Tp  oceanographic                  seconds   numeric
#> 20                ThTp  oceanographic             degrees_true   numeric
#> 21               SprTp  oceanographic                  degrees   numeric
#> 22             QC_Flag        quality                     <NA>   integer
#>                                                            description
#> 1         Unique identifier for each weather buoy station (M1-M6, FS1)
#> 2                           International radio call sign for the buoy
#> 3                     Geographic longitude coordinate of buoy position
#> 4                      Geographic latitude coordinate of buoy position
#> 5                                       Timestamp of measurement (UTC)
#> 6                                    Atmospheric pressure at sea level
#> 7                Air temperature measured 3-4 meters above sea surface
#> 8   Dew point temperature - temperature at which air becomes saturated
#> 9          Direction from which wind is blowing relative to True North
#> 10                            Average wind speed over 10-minute period
#> 11                    Maximum wind speed measured over 3-second period
#> 12                                 Relative humidity of the atmosphere
#> 13                                             Sea surface temperature
#> 14                          Practical salinity of seawater (PSU scale)
#> 15  Significant wave height (Hs) - mean height of highest 1/3 of waves
#> 16                 Mean wave period - average time between wave crests
#> 17                          Mean direction from which waves are coming
#> 18                             Maximum individual wave height observed
#> 19              Peak wave period - period of waves with maximum energy
#> 20                Direction of waves at spectral peak (maximum energy)
#> 21 Directional spreading at spectral peak - wave direction variability
#> 22                Data quality indicator: 0=unknown, 1=good, 9=missing
#>                  typical_range
#> 1  M1, M2, M3, M4, M5, M6, FS1
#> 2                      Various
#> 3              -15.88 to -5.43
#> 4               51.22 to 55.00
#> 5                 2002-present
#> 6                     970-1030
#> 7                    -10 to 30
#> 8                    -15 to 25
#> 9                        0-360
#> 10                        0-60
#> 11                        0-80
#> 12                       0-100
#> 13                        0-25
#> 14                       30-36
#> 15                        0-15
#> 16                        0-20
#> 17                       0-360
#> 18                        0-30
#> 19                        0-25
#> 20                       0-360
#> 21                       0-180
